description:
The American Diabetes Association is looking for an enthusiastic, dynamic, and results-driven Director of Marketing to join our Programs and Partnership marketing team. The Director of Marketing oversees integrated marketing functions of ADA programs and acts as the strategic advisor to stakeholders.  This role is focused on leading strategy and implementing marketing activities targeting B2C and B2B audiences to grow the ADA’s mission.

The role is a fantastic opportunity to work on a mission-driven, innovative team while partnering and representing the ADA with leaders in healthcare and across sectors. Reporting to the Vice President of Marketing, Programs and Partnerships, this role leads a team and strategy to deliver on high-profile initiatives and strategic messaging which support the growth ADA’s brand. The candidate is comfortable efficiently overseeing a diverse portfolio of initiatives, thrives collaborating with multiple internal and external teams, and enjoys developing creative solutions to enhance programs. In addition, we seek a candidate who excels in storytelling through a hands-on approach to reach the goals of the ADA. They are driven and get a high level of satisfaction from helping the team achieve more together.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Lead integrated marketing strategies for programs and partnerships on assigned projects to deliver the ADA’s mission and grow its brand.
• Bring marketing expertise, creativity, and thought leadership to lead and guide a team or marketing professionals through planning discussions in collaboration with cross functional marketing/communication partners to internal and external stakeholders.
• Think strategically to deliver integrated marketing projects from ideation to execution and ongoing adaptation, including leading the discussions with ADA Marketing and Communications team members, setting clear expectations for tasks and deliverables, and communicating these needs to the appropriate teams.
• Responsible for developing and overseeing intentional, data-driven solutions promoting awareness, engagement, and nurtures audiences.
• Consistently work to evolve initiative messaging and storytelling in support of the project’s goals and metrics.
• Represent the ADA and manage initiatives with the marketing agency of record to deliver project goals within scope.
• Participate and support consumer activation and professional engagement workgroup meetings and planning sessions for the initiative’s goals.
• Build and maintain positive relationships with all stakeholders to collaborate with cross-functional teams to set strategy, deliverables, and timelines.
• Oversees and provides actionable feedback to the creative, content strategy and development, with attention to whether the work is on strategy and aligned with the initiative objectives.
• Work within the programs and partnership team process and systems to organizational efficiency and actionable insights.
• The role may at times need to help with initiatives across the larger Marketing team.

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, communications, or a related field
• 10+ years of experience in marketing communications; background working with agencies or in an agency a plus.
• Experience leading marketing strategies and working with cross functional teams in a progressively, evolving environment.
• Experience leading a team of marketing professionals in an agency, corporate or nonprofit environment and comfortable doing so in a remote environment.
• Strong organizational and project management skills, as well as attention to detail

Compensation Range: $88,000 - $96,000 DOE

Take Your Career On A Mission

Are you looking for a career that directly impacts your community and beyond? Over 37 million Americans have diabetes and over 96 million have prediabetes. The American Diabetes Association (ADA) offers a rewarding career working for one of the premier voluntary health organizations in the world supporting people with type 1 & type 2 diabetes. Our employees like working at the ADA because of our mission, the inclusive environment, work-life balance, our benefits and our culture. Joining our dedicated team affords the gratification of knowing beyond a doubt that you will impact the lives and well-being of millions.

Equal Employment Opportunity

It is the policy of the American Diabetes Association to provide equal employment opportunity to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

To find out more about the ADA as well as other exciting and fulfilling career opportunities please visit us at www.diabetes.org/careers. For full consideration, you must apply directly to the Association’s Careers Page.

There’s nothing we can’t do when we’re Connected for Life!
